intro: Styphelia pendula, commonly known as the hanging snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant features small, bell-shaped white flowers that hang in clusters, giving it its common name. Styphelia pendula thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking a native, low-maintenance plant.
